channel.title: Home on Concepts and Causality Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Concepts and Causality Lab

item.title: People
item.description: People We are looking to hire graduate students for this admission cycle (2024-2025). If interested, please contact Tadeg with some information about your research interests and background. Tadeg Quillien (Principal Investigator) I am a chancellor’s fellow (research-focused faculty member) in the Psychology department at the University of Edinburgh. Before that, I was a postdoc with Chris Lucas and Neil Bramley (also at Edinburgh). I did my PhD at UCSB’s Center for Evolutionary Psychology, working with Leda Cosmides and John Tooby.

item.title: Publications
item.description: (standard disclaimer: PDFs are available for non-commercial information purposes only.) If a link is broken, or you have trouble interpreting the data / reproducing an analysis / running a model, please feel free to reach out to tadeg.quillien AT gmail.com. Preprints Guesses as compressed probability distributions T. Quillien, N. Bramley, C. Lucas Pre-print, 2023 [pdf] [code_and_data] [thread] People attribute purpose to autonomous vehicles when explaining their behavior B. Gyevnar, S. Droop, T.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Code and data from papers Code and data from published work are available next to the relevant publications. If a link is broken, or you have trouble interpreting the data / reproducing an analysis / running a model, please feel free to reach out to tadeg.quillien AT gmail.com. More computational cognitive science / causality research at Edinburgh Bramley lab Lucas lab Dan Lassiter Cognition Computation and Development lab Zhao lab (opens January 2025)
